What is the eligibility criteria for B.S: A candidate must have passed the XII standard examination of the Maharashtra Board of Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent with Mathematics and Statistics as one of the subjects. They should have secured not less than 45% marks in aggregate for the open category and 40% for Reserved category candidates.
eligibility for B.Sc. IT: A candidate must have passed the XII standard examination of the Maharashtra Board of Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent with Mathematics and Statistics as one of the subjects. They should have secured not less than 45% marks in aggregate for the open category and 40% for Reserved category candidates.
What is the eligibility criteria for B.S: A candidate must have passed the XII standard examination of the Maharashtra Board of Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent and should have secured not less than 45% marks in aggregate for open category and 40% for Reserved category candidates.
What is the eligibility criteria for Dip: Candidates who have passed a Diploma in Information Technology/Computer Technology/Computer Engineering/Computer Science/Mechanical Engineering and related fields are eligible for direct admission to the second year of the B.Sc. (Data Science) degree course.
What is the eligibility for B.Com. AF?: A candidate must have passed the XII std. Examination of the Maharashtra Board of Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent and secured not less than 45% marks in aggregate for open category candidates (40% for reserved category).
What is the eligibility for B.M.S. (AICT: A candidate must have passed H.S.C. Examination of the Maharashtra Board of Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination or a Diploma in any Engineering branch after S.S.C.
What is the eligibility for B.Com. BI?: A candidate must have passed the XII std. Examination of the Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education, Pune, or its equivalent and secured not less than 45% marks in aggregate for open category candidates (40% for reserved category candidates).
How do I apply for admission?: Every candidate admitted to the degree course must register themselves with the University of Mumbai.
What is the admission process?: Candidates must register with the University of Mumbai after being admitted to the degree course.
How can I contact the admission office?: You can contact the admissions office at admissions@vsit.edu.in or call +91 22 2410 42 44.
What is the contact information for Vidy: Vidyalankar School of Information Technology, Vidyalankar College Marg, Wadala (East), Mumbai - 400037, Phone: +91 22 2410 42 44, Email: admissions@vsit.edu.in.
Who is the admission incharge?: The admission incharge is Mr. Umesh Koyande, available at X116, with office timings from 10.00 am to 5.00 pm. You can reach him at admissions@vsit.edu.in or +91 22 2410 4244 Extension: 3101.
What is the exam pattern at Vidyalankar: The exam pattern is Semester Based, with a Credit and Grading System.
Are diploma students eligible for direct: Yes, diploma students are eligible for direct second-year admission to B.Sc.IT.
